title: PIng
body:
So the last 6 days, I suddenly went from 20-24 ping, up to 98-88 I am very confused as to why, (It isn't my computer) And I have checked my service provider, (as I bypass the router all together when I play) But nothing else seems to have been effected (speed of internet wise) I am wondering, if a Red can tell me if there was a falling out with the service provider I use (CTC) or the coverage for my Area (Mid/top of Minnesota) has been boycotted :) 
Thanks in advance!
-Jargon Wan
{{champion:103}} Main

replies.body:
Since your ping has jumped from around 20 to being at about 90 consistently, there may be something up between your network and our game servers. Since you think your ISP isn't routing your connection to us in a very good way, let's try running a traceroute to see what's going on. Grab WinMTR [**here**](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and for the host use our NA server 104.160.131.1.

Once you've ran that traceroute, copy what it gives you and post it here for us to take a look at!
I should have added I am on a Macbook pro, I can't download the software as it is only tainted towards windows... Is there a Mac version?

{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} Oops! That sure makes it a little difficult to use the tool eh?

Let's try using something called [**Ping Plotter**](https://www.pingplotter.com/download/macos) instead. In the Target field, enter the following addresses one at a time: 192.64.170.252 and then 104.160.131.1. Also, be sure you've set your test parameters for Trace Interval to 1 second and Focus Time to 5 minutes, and then press the play button on the left start to run it.

Once the trace is over, take a screenshot of the results and shoot it my way!

I will have it for you Tomorrow night! I am on a trip right now, kind of counterproductive to do it from a different wifi source then my own. 
Thanks so far!

No worries, you enjoy that trip ^_^!

I'll be sure to keep a lookout for that trace route {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

http://imgur.com/O1Nt6Jq

http://imgur.com/g7o8gbj

http://imgur.com/QYtworK

Here we go :)

Hope your trip was nice ^_^!

I looked over that traceroute, and it does seem like your ping spikes are starting when your connection first hits our servers. I'd like for our tech guys to be able to work one on one with you to get this fixed.

To get started, [**submit a ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and pick "I am having technical issues", and shoot your traceroute their way too!
It was a nice trip, ^-^ Thank you so much! I will do that

I have been having the same issues, I've check internet service, it's fine. I've ran a full scan on my rig, fine.  Only thing I can think of is that it's LoL server side.  This has been happening the same amount of time. I use Verizon Fios, typical 42 ping and I've been getting upwards of the 250-300 range of ping spike.  This typically happens against certain players but not all enemy players.
